means: 单调的语调，单调的声音

sentence.Network_en: The evidence was read out to the court in a dull monotone.
sentence.Network_cn: 证据被当庭呆板地宣读了一遍。

sentence.Network_en: He spoke in a flat monotone.
He was seen on TV delivering platitudes about the crisis in a monotone voice.
sentence.Network_cn: 人们看到他在电视上念经似地就危机问题老调重弹。

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: from modern Latin monotonus, from late Greek monotonos

entry.tran: 单调的语调；一成不变的声音
entry.def: If  someone speaks in a monotone, their voice does not vary at all in tone or loudness and so it is not interesting to listen to.

example.ex: The evidence was read out to the court in a dull monotone.
example.tran: 证据被当庭呆板地宣读了一遍。

entry.tran: (声音或外表)单调的，无变化的
entry.def: A monotone sound or surface does not have any variation in its tone or colour.

example.ex: He was seen on TV delivering platitudes about the crisis in a monotone voice.
example.tran: 人们看到他在电视上念经似地就危机问题老调重弹。

means.word_mean: 2. a single tone repeated with different words or different rhythms (especially in rendering liturgical texts)
1. of a sequence or function; consistently increasing and never decreasing or consistently decreasing and never increasing in value
2. sounded or spoken in a tone unvarying in pitch;
